comment: Tests make up a majority of the grade. Final exam is worth almost 1/3 of your entire grade. He is caring and allows questions, however his method of teaching may not be the most beneficial for everyone. I would recommend looking for another teacher for this class.
Super sweet guy just interact with him and go to office hours if u need!

Listen, he's fine. He's a great guy and blah blah blah. I asked questions in class; his response was look at the board. I am big on understanding the why and not on the how and he only made the how make sense. Idk if this makes sense but I personally wouldn't take him again. If you are okay with just understanding the how then he's perfect for you.
The other review sum him up well. Very caring professor who teaches the material. I'd take him again.

4 tests and a final, with the lowest test grade dropped (excluding the final). Graded chapter quizzes with 3 tries (do all attempts to look back and study)! Skip and you'll do bad, prob what ppl did who are complaining. GO TO CLASS, take notes, and you'll get an A, especially with formula sheets allowed on tests and some tests are curved. So easy

This professor's approach is inconsistent. The course started as if it could be done online but shifted to in-person tests. Attending class often added confusion instead of clarity. I found self-teaching more effective. If you care about your GPA, want to learn, or just need to pass, consider a different professor.

This professor is very sweet and explains concepts and content well. However, the final is 32% of your grade, so no matter how well you do throughout the semester your final ultimately determines your grade. Professor also purposely didn't upload our test grades in the grade book after the first two exams which was frustrating. Curves exams too.

Class is based on 4 exams (2 online lockdown w webcam, 2 in person as well the final). The final is 32% of your grade my lowest exam grade was a 88% and I could still fail the class so thats very stressful. He also drops your lowest exam grade (not the final) and HW grade. He doesn't except any excuses for missing an exam. He's sweet but good luck!

The final is 32% of the grade basically if you do well on every test and homework you're going to be very stressed during finals week. Save the trouble and find a different professor. He goes curve grades which is nice. I've done well (high B average) on all the exams and it's still possible for me to fail the class.

Prof Huang is a great professor. The class is hard, but he does a great job explaining concepts. He provides plenty of study material for tests, and will curve grades if the class does poorly on an exam. Overall, a good choice for finance, especially if you are like me and aren't very good at the subject.
Great Professor, highly recommend!

The BEST professor for Fin4360, Dr.Huang is so helpful and wants everyone in his class to succeed. He's the sweetest man ever and I wish I could take him again. The class itself is very difficult but if you take the time to study using the homework quizzes and extra practice questions you can get the A.
This is a very hard class. However, he's a great professor. He cares and ALWAYS available!! Lots of curves on exams. Take take take Dr.Huang!

I really think he may be the best finance professor at KSU. He really cares about all of his students, and he is very understanding and accommodating. This is a tough class, but he explains concepts really well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Good teacher, provides all info you need for tests. He gives access to all practice exams and chapter files  which is useful for studying. I recommend Dr. Huang!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: The BEST professor. I worked my butt off in this class and really had to study (hard class/material), but professor was willing to meet me and work with me before every single exam. He is patient and wants to help his students succeed. I highly recommend this professor and would take him again!

A Wonderful Professor! He really has taught me so much about investments. This is the hardest finance class that I have taken but HOWEVER, he is always willing to help during office hours. He cares about all of his students. I highly suggest never skipping a lecture otherwise you'll be completely lost. You must put 100%!

Excellent professor. He made learning the material as straightforward as possible. Moved fast at times but was still effective. He actually cares and listens to feedback. The course is very user-friendly with many examples demonstrating concepts and practice problems using formulas. Everything you want it in professor. 5/5 will take again

You CAN NOT find a better professor than this. He is the Most student-centered professor that you will ever have. He wants all his students to do well, and I never have and will never have a professor that cares this much. Don't take Finance unless it is with this professor. He is amazing, and you will not be disappointed. He is here to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: He is good at breaking down complex concepts. Commonly available/accessible in office hours. Given out assignments and ensure's there's practice for exam's. 51 % of the grade is based on exams, 16 % is based on homework, and final exam is worth 32%! Honestly just take him it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Please take Professor Huang! He is an absolutely amazing professor and the best one I have ever had. He makes everything so easy and understandable. He is very kind and always makes himself available ! Do yourself a favor and go with Huang! The class was a breeze.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Read the reviews below because finance is a difficult subject but if you review the homework and practice exam for the test then this should be the easiest A.

Make sure you fully understand the homeworks and do the practice tests! Lectures are fast-paced, so I found it best for me just to sit and listen during lectures, then do the homeworks on my own to get a better understanding. Finance is a difficult subject!!
Study the homework and practice exams for a A on those exams!! His test comes from a test bank.

This class is truly impossible to fail. Very flexible and accessible. Only 4 online tests, all multiple choice. There are detailed practice exams explaining questions exactly as they look on the test. Prof. Huang is such a caring, down-to-earth man, and I genuinely can't think of a single con. TAKE HIM, EASY A!
Easiest A, if you study the homework and practice exams for the test!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Inspirational guy that will always help with any questions that you have, I would take him again. He provides homework and review guides that come from a test bank for exams. 4 exams (1 dropped), a cumulative final (32% of final grade) and weekly homework (16 % of the grade).

Great guy always willing to help you out. Study the formulas and you'll do great. 4 exams plus final 11 homework. Drops the lowest exam and homework. It's super easy if you come to class and pay attention

He is an enthusiastic professor and will answer any questions that you have, I would take him again. He takes 10 of 11 homeworks for 16% of your grade (you get three tries each), 3 of 4 tests which are 51%, and then the final is 32%. The tests are lockdown and a little hard but most questions are similar to the homeworks or in the ppts.

Professor Huang is easily one of the best professors I've had in college. He is very smart and will break down difficult concepts in a way that makes them digestible. He is also very understanding and sweet, so any question you may have he will happily answer. It's really hard not to make at least a B in the class. Just show up and take notes.

Great professor, he does a good job at explaining the concepts in a way that makes sense. Most of the grade comes from tests, which are lockdown/webcam, but most of the questions come from the homework, so if you study the homework you'll do fine. You are allowed to have a formula sheet for the tests.

Finance is difficult, but he makes it easier. He provides homework and review guides that come from a test bank for exams. 4 exams (1 dropped), a cumulative final (32% of final grade) and weekly homework. Allows formula sheet on webcam exams, but it is important to practice. As I said, finance is hard, but if I had to take again, I would take him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: great professor for finance. 4 test (lowest one dropped), and a final. All tests lockdown/webcam. 11 homework assignments. uses powerpoint for notes, so good notes + all assignments completed, should not have less than a B.

11 Homework per semester, but only 10 are counted. 4 exams, but the lowest is dropped. The final exam is mandatory and is worth 32% of your grade. Lectures are boring but are very insightful. Professor explains the material very well. He makes math easy.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Huang is a very nice professor. His lectures can be a bit difficult to understand because he wears a mask and it can be hard to hear him, but he does a great job lecturing. You can also learn all the material from his PowerPoints. His exams and quizzes were easy and he's willing to let you reschedule exams. Great guy, take him!

Rongbing is a very caring professor. This is a HEAVY TEST GRADE. like 65% of the class is 4 tests. The attendance policy is VERY relaxed. Tests are lockdown browser + proctored. He allows formula sheets and will move the test time if you need. Very tedious lectures and he goes the FULL 50 minutes so that can get boring, but other than that hes cool
Easy A tests are taken online with a lockdown browser if you catch my drift. Classes are a little boring and only a little homework but the homework and practice exams are exactly like the tests.

Definelty take this class. Lectures can get a little boring he is such a sweet guy. He tells fun little jokes that arent always the funniest but still make you laugh. He explains things well and is always able to help you. Homeworks are graded with 3 attempts and all questions are pulled from test bank. Makes quizlets and studying very manageable.

Huang was a great professor. Graded on 4 tests(drops lowest one), Final worth 32%, and 11 practices quizzes graded as homework. If you show up to class and do the homework you should be able to get an A.

Huang is a sweetie. There are 11 homework quizzes where hell drop the lowest and 4 tests where hell drop the lowest as well. His final is 32% of your overall grade though, so make sure you do well on the rest of the work throughout the semester. Loved how we didnt have to go to class and was easily accessible outside of class. Take him!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Huang is amazing! I took him for the summer & we had 3 tests, a final, plus HW quizzes. Each quiz you have 3 attempts.. he keeps the highest attempt & grades 10/11. The tests are fairly easy if you study the content, practice exam & your HW attempts. For tests, he keeps 2/3 & the final can't be dropped. 10/10 recommend him! He truly cares too
Most simple, chill, and informative lectures. Always in a great mood. Would highly recommend for FIN3100.

Bc of covid, the class was in person once a week, so basically hybrid. He had videos for everything. You can learn all the material from just his lectures. He is great at explaining everything clearly & simply. He cares about everyone understanding the material. Allows a formula sheet for tests & drops lowest. Final is worth a lot, so don't slack.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is soo sweet, caring, and understanding. His tests are decent. If you study his practice problems and practice tests you'll do fine. Allowed formula sheets too! 4 test and he drops one. Cumulative final that was not too difficult.

There are 4 tests and a final. Drops the lowest grade of the 4 tests. There are study guides for each test, which is rare for a prof. Tests are similar to the study guides except for the concept questions. Some of the tests have non-multiple choice questions. You are allowed formula sheets for each test. Practice study guides and you'll be fine.

By far the nicest and most caring professor I have ever had. Always made sure that students understood material before moving on. Used real life examples of finance. 4 exams with lowest one dropped and cumulative final. Study your textbook and lectures because exams are a mix of both. In class worksheets are your key to doing well on exams.

the class and material is not the easiest but he makes a real effort to make sure all of his students understand the concepts, probably the nicest professor iv ever had who is willingly help you one on one in case you're stuck. he allows formula sheets on all quizzes and tests

There are five quizzes and one final exam. He drops the lowest quiz. It' a hard class; however, he is very passionate about finance and he genuinely wants you to pass. He's willing to help you at anytime around your schedule.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Very straight forward about what's on exams and quizzes. He's very helpful in ensuring you do well if you study and review. Chill guy.

He's a very caring and nice professor, he teaches the material well and provides plenty of in class material to prepare you for the quizzes/test. Please attend his classes, you're not going to pass if you don't, you can't pass by just reading his D2L power points. His lectures are not boring and will provide you with the knowledge to succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: Really sweet. All notes are posted online but he gives handouts and practice problems in class which helps a lot and is exactly what you will see on the exams. MyFinanceLab assignments are extra credit, cumulative final :/

Nicest guy ever! Maybe not the easiest A but if you get less than a B in his class you just suck. Super nice, informative, and always in a good mood. Take him if you can. You can't help but learn a lot from him.

3 tests, a cumulative final and a small project. If you start off poorly with the tests you may as well quit. HOWEVER, his tests are the practice tests almost verbatim. His lectures aren't necessary as all the notes are online and he just reads from the PP anyway but there are typically 1-2 questions on exams from discussions.

You know exactly what to expect on the tests. If you do the practice problems on the handouts and read the required articles, you should be good. Sometimes reading the PowerPoint slides will help, too. He is more than willing to help if you have a question, and his workload for a 4000 level course is very reasonable. 85 is an A, 75 is a B and so on

Your grade in his class will be determined by how much you study, PERIOD. He gives you everything you need to know, on D2L. You do not need to go to class or get the textbook, just study all of the PowerPoint, handouts, practice exams, and articles that he gives out. It is a lot though. 3 tests make up a total of 73% of your grade, but a 75 is a B

Rongbing is a good guy. He really wants every student to well in his class. If you show up, do homework as you go, and study for the exams, you'll get an A. He is responsive, and helpful in any way that he can be of assistance. I enjoyed his Saturday class, and would highly recommend him for Finance 3100!
Amount of information needed to learn to pass the test is ridiculous. So many short answer and long math questions on test.

It was a great class and professor overall. He did provide some very useful information on how to invest in the securities market. Tests are composed of mc, essay and non-mc math questions. Study the study guides because they do a good job preparing you for the tests (especially for the math and essay portions).

Very approachable. Always in a good mood. Pop quizzes are hard and count for 10% of final grade, but he dropped the lowest 2. Exams a mostly multiple choice and have a few essay questions and math problems.  He's a good teacher and tries very hard to make sure every one does well.  I'd take him again.

3 exams each worth 25% (no cumulative final). Computer project worth 7%, Investment game worth 8%, and all quizes together worth 10% of final grade. A= 85 or better, B= 75-84 etc. Interesting subject but the lectures were very dry. He provides old exams and quizes from past semesters. STUDY those because they look similar to the exams given.

Tests are just like the homeworks. If you study the homework and old tests then you should do well on all the exams.  He grades pretty hard but an 85-100 is an A. Overall a good teacher. I learned a lot in this class but I did have to put in a little effort for my A. I definitely recommend taking him.
As long as you keep up you can earn an A. Attendance is required but warning: he teaches from PPT and he can put you to sleep! Do the work, tests come from HW, and you will do fine.

Excellent Professor.  Dr. Huang is very helpful.  You must read the text and review the lecture notes.  Attendance is not mandatory but he takes the roll every meeting.  If you miss too many classes he will drop you 1 letter grade.  Read the text, lecture notes and complete homework, and you will be fine.  Use Formula sheets on tests.
Good classs and teaches with lot of passion. Investment Analysis is worth taking from him.

The first 1/3 of the course is "review" and not graduate investment analysis.  Lots of focus on algebracially manipulaing formulas.  Light calculas required!  Problems not practical in terms of whats given and manipulations required to get answers, but good math students will do well.  Understand main pts in aritcles. Quizes curved sometime
